entry.title: Mr. and Mrs. Durham
entry.summary:
Author: Donnaez

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,515Chapters: 2/5Kudos: 6

Summary: Beaumont, Oklahoma is supposed to be a small town like any other. But a curious characteristic of it is that, for the past eighteen years, twenty-seven men from the city had allegedly ran away from their wives and skipped town to be never seen again. Their only final message to their past lives being a very personal note explaining why they were leaving. The occurrence in any other context would have been nothing but a simple sad statistic, if all of them didn’t have the same characteristic in common: couples’ counseling with a woman named Aubrey Holman. Now, you and Jason are sent while undercover as a problematic newly wed couple to investigate the woman by hoping to be their next victim.

entry.title: Anywhere and Everywhere
entry.summary:
Author: Thewriting_hub

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 53,141Chapters: 14/40Kudos: 304

Summary: Jason was your everything. No matter how many years pass, you'll never recover from how he was taken from you. You still saw him, anywhere and everywhere. Sometimes it comforted you knowing you would never truly be without him but sometimes it was very inconvenient. Like tonight, Scarecrow was planning on a mass release of his newest fear toxin, not to mention he was working with someone new on the Gotham crime scene but they seemed so very familiar.

entry.title: A Firecracker With Child
entry.summary:
Author: thebatdadnomad (aylooktaekook)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,865Chapters: 1/3Kudos: 11

Summary: “Pretty,” you repeated, slowly, and Jason watched for any sign of the fire returning, any sign of your fury or fear or apprehension to make another appearance. But you looked different somehow, deflated as you peered up into his eyes from where you stood, and he felt the sudden urge to throw the shopping bags into the still closed boot and haul you home to his place instead of yours. “Yeah…” Jason grunted, too stiff to be nonchalant as he looked away. “That's what you are.” Or, the fact that you, a gorgeous woman growing an entire baby human in your body, was out doing your own groceries was unacceptable. Fucking Gotham.

entry.title: Strangers in the Night
entry.summary:
Author: unnamedmystery

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,593Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 97

Summary: When the Daily Planet heard word of a new vigilante in Crime Alley that supposedly had no affiliation with Batman, Perry White thought it to be a nice short story—a quick in and out. After all, while the people of Metropolis had Superman, everyone knew of Batman, and a vigilante not working with him seemed interesting.At least, that’s what Perry told his college intern. And her mentor Clark Kent when he raised concerns.No one told her that the vigilante was intimidatingly attractive. Or that Crime Alley was the worse place in Gotham City. Or that her mentor would ask a friend to keep tabs on her. Or that the detective she’s staying with hates Batman despite working with him frequently. Or that the detectives neighbor was a really cute guy.

entry.title: Burning House
entry.summary:
Author: Yes_I_have_daddy_issues

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,383Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 36

Summary: We were kids together, growing up in the same crime ridden alleyways and neighborhoods, just two doors down the road from each other. “I’ll find a way.” he turned back to face me, a big smile stretching across his face, one I would never forget, the light in his eyes visible.I never saw Jason again after that night. Not in person at least.On the news, getting adopted by Bruce Wayne of all people, waving and smiling to the cameras, it never reached his eyes the way his smile always did when we were younger.Then he vanished for good.
